TRUDI 2026 is a workshop bringing together users and developers of the Trixi Framework, which
includes the Julia packages [Trixi.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/Trixi.jl),
[TrixiShallowWater.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/TrixiShallowWater.jl),
[TrixiAtmo.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/TrixiAtmo.jl), and
[TrixiParticles.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/TrixiParticles.jl). The program will feature
talks, tutorials, and hackathons aimed at consolidating the existing community, aligning long-term
strategy, and advancing key features in high-performance scientific computing.

In addition to the main Trixi Framework packages, we rely on - and actively collaborate with - a
broader ecosystem of upstream dependencies and partner projects maintained by members of our
community, including (but not limited to):

- [HOHQMesh](https://github.com/trixi-framework/HOHQMesh) · [HOHQMesh.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/HOHQMesh.jl)
- [libtrixi](https://github.com/trixi-framework/libtrixi)
- [p4est](https://github.com/cburstedde/p4est) · [P4est.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/P4est.jl)
- [PointNeighbors.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/PointNeighbors.jl)
- [StartUpDG.jl](https://github.com/jlchan/StartUpDG.jl)
- [SummationByPartsOperators.jl](https://github.com/ranocha/SummationByPartsOperators.jl)
- [t8code](https://github.com/DLR-AMR/t8code) · [T8code.jl](https://github.com/DLR-AMR/T8code.jl)
- [Trixi2Vtk.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/Trixi2Vtk.jl)
- [TrixiBottomTopography.jl](https://github.com/trixi-framework/TrixiBottomTopography.jl)
- [TrixiLW.jl](https://github.com/Arpit-Babbar/TrixiLW.jl)

The event is co-hosted by [SNuBIC](snubic.qmd), the DFG
research unit on "Structure-preserving Numerical Methods for Bulk and Interface-Coupling of
Heterogeneous Models" (FOR5409).
